唱.definition: to sing; to call loudly; to chant

唱反調.definition: to express a different view; to take a different position

唱和.definition: antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus); sung reply (in agreement with first voice); to reply with a poem in the same rhythm

唱商.definition: one's ability to give a convincing performance of a song

唱喏.definition: (old) to bow and utter polite phrases; to open the way (for a dignitary etc)

唱對臺戲.definition: to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb; to get into confrontation

唱念.definition: (of a waiter) to call out (a customer's order to the kitchen)

唱片.definition: gramophone record; LP; music CD; musical album; CL:張|张[zhang1]

唱白臉.definition: to play the role of the villain (idiom)

唱票.definition: to read ballot slips out loud

唱空城計.definition: lit. to sing "The Empty City Stratagem" (idiom); fig. to put up a bluff to conceal one's weakness; (jocular) (of a place etc) to be empty; (of one's stomach) to be rumbling

唱紅臉.definition: to play the role of the hero (idiom); to play the good cop

唱雙簧.definition: lit. to sing a duet; fig. to collaborate with sb; also used satirically: to play second fiddle to

唱頭.definition: pickup (cartridge assembly of a vinyl record player)

唱高調.definition: to sing the high part; to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)

唱高調兒.definition: erhua variant of 唱高調|唱高调[chang4 gao1 diao4]

唱黑臉.definition: to play the role of the strict parent (or superior etc)
